definitions: To mark out the boundaries of something with stakes.
To support or fasten with a stake or stakes.
To risk something, typically money, on the outcome of a game, race, or other unpredictable event.
To claim or reserve a share or right in something.
examples: He stakes his claim on the land.
The gardener stakes the young tree.
She stakes a large sum on the horse race.
The company stakes its future on this new product.
